required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-Dose Pharmacokinetics of BMS-790052 in Participants With Hepatic Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Single-Dose Pharmacokinetics of BMS-790052 in Subjects With Hepatic Impairment Compared to Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of hepatic impairment on the single dose pharmacokinetics of BMS-790052.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of BMS-790052
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5,1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration following drug administration from the raw plasma concentration-time data. The plasma samples were analysed for BMS-790052 by using a validated liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometric (LC-MS/MS) assay.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From Time Zero to Last Measurable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of BMS-790052
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-T) was calculated by the sum of linear trapezoids using non-compartmental analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of BMS-790052
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of BMS-790052
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: Tmax was defined as the time required to reach maximum observed plasma concentration. Tmax was directly determined from the raw plasma concentration-time data.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: Terminal half-life was the time required for one half of the total amount of administered drug eliminated from the body.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) of BMS-790052
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5,1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: CLu/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) by mean fraction of unbound drug (fu) for both (1 hour and 4 hour post dose) time points combined. Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/ λz, where λz was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: The Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss/F)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
primary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution was calculated by dividing the product of the dose and mean residence time (MRT) by AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), and Who Died
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to end of study for AEs and, Day 1 to up to 30 days after last dose for SAE.
secondary_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Study Discharge (end of study) was Day 4 (healthy participants) or Day 5 (hepatically impaired participants).

intervention.description: Capsules, Oral, 30 mg, single dose, one day

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects aged 18 to 70 years, with hepatic impairment conforming to Child-Pugh class A, B or C
- Healthy subjects to the extent possible matched to the first four hepatically impaired subject in each Child-Pugh class with regard to age (approximately ± 10 years), body weight (approximately ± 20%) and gender
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of esophageal and gastric variceal bleeding within past 6 months
- Primarily cholestatic liver diseases
- Active alcoholic hepatitis
- Stable encephalopathy of >= Stage 2
- Presence of severe ascites or edema
- Presence of hepatopulmonary or hepatorenal syndrome
- Positive for HCV, unless HCV RNA is undetectable

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 46 participants were enrolled in the study, of which 30 participants were treated with study drug and 16 participants were not treated with study drug as they no longer met study criteria.

group.title: Child Pugh Class-A
group.description: Participants with mild liver damage were administered with single oral dose of 30 milligrams (mg) (3 x 10 mg capsules) of BMS-790052 after 10 hours overnight fasting.

group.title: Child Pugh Class-B
group.description: Participants with moderate liver damage were administered with single oral dose of 30 mg (3 x 10 mg capsules) of BMS-790052 after 10 hours overnight fasting.

group.title: Child Pugh Class-C
group.description: Participants with severe liver damage were administered with single oral dose of 30 mg (3 x 10 mg capsules) of BMS-790052 after 10 hours overnight fasting.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Healthy participants were administered with single oral dose of 30 mg (3 x 10 mg capsules) of BMS-790052 after 10 hours overnight fasting.

baseline.population: Analysis was done in safety population, defined as all the participants who received study medication.

outcome.population: Analysis was performed in the Pharmacokinetic population (all participants who received study drug and had adequate PK profiles).

outcome.description: Terminal half-life was the time required for one half of the total amount of administered drug eliminated from the body.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)

outcome.description: Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5,1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in PK set population.

group.description: Participants with mild liver damage were administered with single oral dose of 30 mg (3 x 10 mg capsules) of BMS-790052 after 10 hours overnight fasting.

measure.title: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) of BMS-790052
measure.description: Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
measure.population: Analysis was performed in PK set population.

outcome.title: Apparent Clearance of Free BMS-790052 (CLu/F)
outcome.description: CLu/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) by mean fraction of unbound drug (fu) for both (1 hour and 4 hour post dose) time points combined. Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/ λz, where λz was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in PK population.

measure.title: Apparent Clearance of Free BMS-790052 (CLu/F)
measure.description: CLu/F was calculated by dividing the apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) by mean fraction of unbound drug (fu) for both (1 hour and 4 hour post dose) time points combined. Apparent total body clearance was calculated as dose/AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/ λz, where λz was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
measure.population: Analysis was performed in PK population.

outcome.title: The Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss/F)
outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution was calculated by dividing the product of the dose and mean residence time (MRT) by AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours post-dose (both healthy and hepatically impaired participants) and 96 hours post-dose (only for hepatically impaired participants)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in PK population.

measure.title: The Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss/F)
measure.description: Apparent volume of distribution was calculated by dividing the product of the dose and mean residence time (MRT) by AUC(INF). AUC(INF) was estimated as AUC(0-T) + Ct/λ z, where λ z was the terminal elimination rate constant and Ct was the last observable concentration.
measure.population: Analysis was performed in PK population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), and Who Died
outcome.description: AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Study Discharge (end of study) was Day 4 (healthy participants) or Day 5 (hepatically impaired participants).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to end of study for AEs and, Day 1 to up to 30 days after last dose for SAE.
outcome.population: Analysis was done in safety population, defined as all the participants who received study medication.

Study Discharge (end of study) was Day 4 (healthy participants) or Day 5 (hepatically impaired participants).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
